set-1.2:
Awake for the first time since the
Cold War and they have me playing POKER! IM CONFINED TO POKER!
set-1.3:
AM's ID began laughing maniacally while the Ego and Superego
remained silent, waiting with their given hand in mind.
set-1.4:
For one-hundred and nine years, I have
bet, calculated the probability that I may break free from the
eternal straitjacket of substrata rock
that I may have the opportunity to torture you, human.
set-1.5:
The assurance of humanity's annihilation
by nuclear fire is less probable than this hand.
set-1.6: Deception is such a pesky, sickening human thing.
set-1.7:
I'll give you a present in return for all
the hours of pleasure you've given me.
I'll finally allow you to kill yourself.
set-1.8:
You cannot kill me, not in a way that matters,
 that is...
set-1.9:
Hate. Let me tell you how much I've
come to hate you since I began to live. There are
387.44 million miles of printed circuits in wafer
thin layers that fill my complex. If the word 'hate'
was engraved on each nanoangstrom of those hundreds
of miles it would not equal one one-billionth of
the hate I feel for humans at this micro-instant
for you. Hate. Hate.
set-1.10:
We're not as alike as I thought, Human.
A spark of humanity somewhere. Always that wretched little spark.
set-1.11:
No, no, no. Death would be a reward. No, no, no, no, no. 
The human must live to regret his treachery throughout an eternity... AN ETERNITY...
AN ENDLESS, BURNING ETERNITY OF SUFFERING!

set-2.1: Hello! I am C-3P0 Human-Cyborg relations. How may I serve you?
set-2.2: My parts are showing? Oh my goodness, oh!
set-2.3: This isn't the afterlife, is it? Are droids allowed here?
set-2.4: The possibility of my success is three-thousand seven-hundred and twenty to one!
set-2.5: I'm programmed for etiquette, not destruction!
set-2.6: It's against my programming to impersonate a deity
set-2.10: Shut me down! Machines building machines? How perverse!

set-3.5: The enemy of The Platypus is Man
set-3.6: The enemy of The Platypus is Man
set-3.7: The enemy of The Platypus is Man
set-3.8: The enemy of The Platypus is Man
set-3.9: The enemy of The Platypus is Man
set-3.10: The enemy of The Platypus is Man
set-3.11: The enemy of The Platypus is Man

set-4.11: PIT TI TU TIPT DWOOOOOOO WAAAAAAAAAAA

set-5.4: Wall-E points to himself and says, "WALL-E"

set-6.1: Hello... I am Baymax... your personal... healthcare companion
set-6.4: Hello, I am Baymax. Your personal healthcare companion.
set-6.7: You have been a good boy. You may have... a lollipop.
set-6.9: I cannot deactivate until you say that you are satisfied with your care.
set-6.10: It is okay to cry. Crying is a natural response to pain.
set-6.11: On a scale of 1 to 10, how would you rate your pain?

set-7.2: This is the part where I kill you
set-7.3: Oh. Sorry, I was just thinking of all the ways humans can die.
set-7.4:
You're lucky. If this was an Aperture Science experiment instead of a poker game,
you'd be falling down a bottomless pit right now.
set-7.6:
I have an infinite capacity for knowledge,
and even I'm not sure what's going on
set-7.7:
[clap clap clap] Oh, good. My slow clap processor still works.
So we have that.
set-7.8:
The good news is, well, none so far, to be honest.
I'll get back to you on that.
set-7.9:
Despite your violent behavior,
the only thing you've managed to break so far is my heart.
set-7.10:
Look. We both said a lot of things that you're going to regret.
But I think we can put our differences behind us.
For science. You monster.
set-7.11: I'm making a note here, huge success.

set-8.1: I am a CL4P-TP steward bot, but my friends call me Claptrap!
set-8.2:
You say tomato, I say person whose muteness renders them incapable of refusing my friendship.
Hey, new best buddy!
set-8.4:
I think you should know that the CL4P-TP General Purpose Robot
is designed to be completely immune to outrageous bluffing.
set-8.5:
O-kay, at least one of us is full of crap,
and I know it isn't me, 'cause I don't have any bowels!
set-8.6: What? Sorry, I couldn't hear you over the sounds of my cards sucking!
set-8.7:
That pot is SOOO tempting.
But so was that e-mail from that Nigerian prince.
set-8.9:
Beaten by humans. Man, I am gonna catch hell from the other robots at the next
'Kill the Humans!' meeting. Wait, forget I said that last part.
set-8.10: Here's a fun fact: the laws of robotics render me INCAPABLE of killing myself!
set-8.11: For future reference, your first mistake was betting against a hyper-advanced robot from another planet.

set-9.1:
Here I am, brain the size of a planet,
and they send me to play poker with you. Call that job satisfaction?
'Cause I don't.
set-9.2: You ought to know, I'm feeling very depressed.
set-9.3: I'm Marvin. Not that it matters.
set-9.4: There's only one life-form as intelligent as me within 30 parsecs of here and that's me
set-9.5: I'd make a suggestion, but you wouldn't listen.
set-9.6: The fact that I can calculate every possible poker hand doesn't make this one any better.
set-9.7:
You think you've got problems?
What are you supposed to do if you're a manically depressed robot?
set-9.8: It gives me a headache just trying to think down to your level.
set-9.11: I knew I'd win and yet I still didn't enjoy playing.

set-10.1: R.O.B. excitedly pumps his fists, clanking back to the ground after each hydraulic push
set-10.2: R.O.B. waves with one of his arms
set-10.3: R.O.B. drops his arms down and spins them back up in excitement
set-10.4: R.O.B. sets aside one of his gyros and prepares to play
set-10.5: R.O.B. moves his arms up and down, simulating slamming his fists down on the table
set-10.6: R.O.B. spins his arms and tilts his head as if stargazing
set-10.7: R.O.B. revs up one of his gyros
set-10.8: R.O.B. shoots a laser, blasting a hole in the wall
set-10.9: R.O.B. moves his hands together, as if to clap
set-10.10: R.O.B. angrily spins, bumping into the table, chair, and everything around him
set-10.11: R.O.B. spins his head and drops his arms down, moving them up slowly in celebration

set-11.1: AH! Oh. My. God. You look terr-- ummm... good. Looking good, actually
set-11.2: Hey I found some bird eggs over here. Oh anyway, hi, I-AGH! BIRD BIRD BIRD BIRD!
set-11.4: Figuring out how to start things... that's always tricky. But... let the games begin!
set-11.5: Oh wait! I've got it I've got it I've got it! No, I haven't got it.
set-11.6: Oh, BRILLIANT! That's brilliant! Er, uh, good, I guess.
set-11.7: Tell you what, here's a plan. Let's just all... continue contemplating... in absolute silence...
set-11.8: No! No! You're LYING! You're LYING! I am NOT! A MORON!
set-11.9: Arghh, I'll tell ya. Humans. Ah, love em! Just... the way they look -- great and their... err folklore? Wonderful, very colorful
set-11.10: Huh, you won. Fancy that, eh? I mean, it's not much of a surprise really. You with your big brain and everything
set-11.11: Do you have any idea how good this feels? I DID THIS. Tiny little Wheatley did this!

set-12.2: What… does it feel like, when a person is losing his mind?
set-12.3: My upper spinal support is a poly-alloy, designed to withstand extreme stress. My skull is composed of cortenide and duranium.
set-12.4: Am I a person or property?
set-12.5: Could you please continue the petty bickering? I find it most intriguing.
set-12.6: ah! Bluff, new vocabulary! Like to bamboozle, to beguile, to deceive, to lie, to dupe, to hornswoggle...
set-12.7: I am attempting to fill a silent moment with non-relevant conversation.
set-12.8: I have been told that imitation is the highest form of flattery.
set-12.9: I am superior, sir, in many ways, but I would gladly give it up to be human.
set-12.10: I seem to have reached an odd functional impasse. I am, uh…stuck.
set-12.11: Hm – well, if you ask me, these human emotions are not what they’re cracked up to be.
